settings.head: Growing up in the U.S., being Indian wasn’t always “cool”
settings.text:
Our Mom wasn’t forcing us into arranged marriages. Doctor and engineer weren’t our only career options. And no — our meals weren’t some kind of digestive gamble (though they were definitely packed with flavor).

What we saw in media and retail rarely reflected who we really were. It felt flat, stereotypical, or disconnected — either too traditional, or stripped of culture altogether.

settings.head: Positive storytelling can shift perceptions & challenge stereotypes.
settings.text: Just as French epiceries and Italian delicatessens have shaped how the West sees those cultures – and have elevated them to a place of high regard – we want to do the same through food, craft, and storytelling.

settings.head: Pitara means treasure chest in Hindi, Urdu, and Punjabi.
settings.text: We work with ethical small businesses to thoughtfully curate hidden gems from across South Asia. We go the extra mile to find products that shine a light on underrepresented communities, and reflect the depth and richness of Desi culture.
